questions.question: What two nations fought in the War of 1812?

choices.answer: France & U.S.
France & Britain
U.S.& Britain
U.S. & Native Americans
Young men who voted to go to war against Native Americans.
Young citizens who fought in the War of 1812.
Young Congressmen who declared war on Britain's economy.
Young Congressman who supported war with Britain.

questions.question: What is being illustrated in the picture?

choices.answer: Embargo Act
Impressment
Neutrality
Non-Intercourse Act

questions.question: Why did the Embargo Act fail?

choices.answer: It caused American merchants to lose money.
It didn't fail.
The Federalist party rallied and killed the law.
It caused British sailors to revolt against the French.

questions.question: Why did many Native Americans support the British in the war?

choices.answer: N.A. wanted to get the newest weapons & technology.
N.A. wanted to be on the good side of the British king.
N.A. wanted to stop Americans from expanding westward.
N.A. wanted the British to teach them to make tea.

questions.question: What battle influenced the Star-Spangled Banner?

choices.answer: Burning of D.C.
Battle of New Orleans.
Battle of Bladensburg.
Battle of Fort McHenry.

questions.question: What are THREE causes of the War of 1812?

choices.answer: Impressment, weapons to Natives, burning of D.C.
Impressment, weapons to Natives, block U.S. trade
Impressment, block U.S. trade, Burning of D.C.
Impressment, block U.S. trade, Louisiana Purchase

questions.question: What was the MAJOR outcome of the war?

choices.answer: U.S. able to help Napoleon beat British.
British able to continue trading with all nations.
U.S. able to stay neutral and ban all trade once again.
Growth of pride & patriotism in the U.S.

questions.question: What interesting fact about Battle of New Orleans is TRUE?

choices.answer: Jackson was taken prisoner by the British.
Happened after the peace treaty was signed & ended the war.
Happened in a foreign country, Belgium.
The British won, even though they were outnumbered.
